document.masterDocTitle: Unraveling one of the ‘ Big Five’: update of the taxonomy of Triphoridae (Gastropoda, Triphoroidea) from Brazil

figureCitation.captionText: Fig. 95. Triphora atlantica Smith, 1890. A. Lectotype, NHM 1889.10.1.1374. B. MNRJ 18693*, 5.63 mm. C. MNRJ 18972*, 3.71 mm. D. MNRJ 31984*, 6.65 mm. E–F, H. Same shell as B. G. Same shell as D. I–K. Same shell as C. Scale bars:A–E = 1 mm; F–H = 500 µm; I, K = 100 µm; J = 50 µm. Photo credits A: Andreia Salvador (NHM).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Triforis atlantica
Smith , 1890: 292
, pl. 21 fig. 26.
Triphora atlantica
– Rolán & Fernández-Garcés 2008: 146 , fig. 25a–i. — Lee 2009: 92 . — Garcia & Lee 2011 . —
Fernandes et al . 2013: 15
, figs 15,
26, 36.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 95.
Triphora atlantica
Smith, 1890. A . Lectotype, NHM 1889.10.1.1374. B . MNRJ 18693*, 5.63 mm. C . MNRJ 18972*, 3.71 mm. D . MNRJ 31984*, 6.65 mm. E–F, H . Same shell as B. G . Same shell as D. I–K . Same shell as C. Scale bars:A–E = 1 mm; F–H = 500 µm; I, K = 100 µm; J = 50 µm. Photo credits A: Andreia Salvador (NHM).
